text: A Message Concerning the Philistines
The word of Yahweh that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning \add the\add* Philistines ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 47:1 \ft Literally “at not yet” \f* Pharaoh attacked Gaza.
Thus says Yahweh:
“Look, waters \add are\add* rising from \add the\add* north,
and they will become as a raging torrent,
and they will overflow \add the\add* land,
and that which fills it,
\add the\add* city and those who live in it.
And the people will cry out,
and every inhabitant of the land will wail,
from the sound of the stamping of the hoofs of his stallions,
from the clattering of his chariots,\f + \fr 47:3 \ft Hebrew “chariot” \f*
the noise of their wheels.
Fathers do not turn to \add their\add* children
because of \add the\add* slackness of \add their\add* hands.
Because of the day that is coming
to destroy all \add the\add* Philistines,
to cut off from Tyre and from Sidon
every survivor \add who could\add* help,
for Yahweh \add is\add* destroying \add the\add* Philistines,
the remnant of the coastland of Caphtor.
Baldness has come upon Gaza,
Ashkelon is destroyed.
O remnant of their valley,
⸤how long⸥\f + \fr 47:5 \ft Literally “until when” \f* will you cut yourself with a blade?
Ah, sword of Yahweh,
⸤how long⸥\f + \fr 47:6 \ft Literally “until when” \f* will you not be quiet?
Gather to your sheath,
keep quiet and stand still.
How can you be quiet
when Yahweh has given an order to it?
Against Ashkelon and against the shore of the sea,
there he has appointed it.”
